hedline.hl1: Sony to Shrink PlayStation And Add Phone Connection

abstract.p: Sony will introduce PS One game system, smaller version of PlayStation that can connect to mobile phones (S)

block.p: There is a new Sony PlayStation on the way, and it's not the PlayStation 2.

There is a new Sony PlayStation on the way, and it's not the PlayStation 2.

In October, Sony will introduce the PS One game system, a much smaller version of the PlayStation that can connect to mobile phones. While the PS One will still require an AC adapter, it is intended to make the wildly popular PlayStation system more portable.

Sony intends for game players to use the PS One, which will be one-third the size of PlayStation, in their new television-equipped cars and pack up the system to take to friends' houses. Sony will also sell a four-inch L.C.D. screen for the PS One in the spring of 2001; the screen will allow it to be run without a television monitor.
The PS One can also be connected to a mobile phone so players can load new games and exchange game data. Sony says it will sell a mobile phone connector for the original Play Station in the winter.

PS One will first go on sale in Japan in July, and it will be priced at about $140. The PlayStation 2, a more advanced system, will be sold in North America in October for $299. But sales of the original system remain strong, said Molly Smith, a spokeswoman at Sony Computer Entertainment America, even though PlayStation 2 will be able to run all of the original system's games.
